snippet: Some high-rises with large populations of Orthodox Jews have elevators programmed to stop without a push of a button from sundown Friday to sundown Saturday.
abstract: The Appraisal column; some New York City high-rises with large populations of Orthodox Jews have elevators programmed to stop without a push of a button from sundown Friday to sundown Saturday, in line with prohibition against pushing elevator buttons on the Sabbath.
lead_paragraph: Some high-rises with large populations of Orthodox Jews have elevators programmed to stop without a push of a button from sundown Friday to sundown Saturday.

headline.seo: On Jewish Sabbath, Elevators That Do All the Work
headline.main: For Jewish Sabbath, Elevators Do All the Work
headline.print_headline: For Jewish Sabbath, Elevators Do All the Work
